text: The Three Investigators is an American juvenile detective book series. It was first published as "Alfred Hitchcock and the Three Investigators" . It was created by Robert Arthur, Jr.. He modeled his series after the popular The Hardy Boys books.The Boy Detectives: Essays on the Hardy Boys and Others, ed. Michael G. Cornelius (Jefferson: McFarland & Co., Publishers, 2010), p. 136 The characters known as the "three investigators" are three boys named Jupiter Jones, Peter Crenshaw and Bob Andrews.The Boy Detectives: Essays on the Hardy Boys and Others, ed. Michael G. Cornelius (Jefferson: McFarland & Co., Publishers, 2010), p. 16 The original series of 43 books was published from 1964 to 1987 by Random House.Deutsch Als Fremdsprache, eds. Steven D.
